Prepare beam.specs

Source: R/prep_beam_specs.R
prep_beam_specs.Rd

Prepare the beam.specs data.frame for BEAM model fitting. Specifies the univariate models needed to compute the BEAM set p-values.

Usage

prep_beam_specs(
  beam.data,
  endpts,
  firth = TRUE,
  adjvars = NULL,
  endptmdl = NULL
)

Arguments

beam.data

A beam.data object from prep_beam_data

endpts

A vector of endpoint variable names in main.data

firth

A logical value. If TRUE (defaul) fit Firth penalized Cox model to account for monotone likelihood in the presence of rare events or predictors. If FALSE fit usual Cox model.

adjvars

Default NULL, optional vector of adjustment variable names in main.data

endptmdl

Optional model specification data.frame with endpoint name column called "endpt" and model string column called "mdl"

Value

beam.specs, a data.frame specifying the omics-endpoint association models to be fit

Examples

data(clinf)
data(omicdat)
data(omicann)
data(setdat)
test.beam.data <- prep_beam_data(main.data=clinf, mtx.data=omicdat,
                                 mtx.anns=omicann, set.data=setdat,
                                 set.anns=NULL, n.boot=10, seed=123)
#> Checking inputs: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Checking that each element of mtx.data is a matrix: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Checking that each element of mtx.anns is a data.frame: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#> Aligning main.data with each mtx.data: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Working on mtx.data Lesion (1 of 2): Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Working on mtx.data RNA (2 of 2): Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#> Warning: Some ids not matched; returning NAs for those.
#>   Working on mtx.anns: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Matching matrix 1 with annotations: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Matching matrix 2 with annotations: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>   Checking set.data: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>     Ordering and indexing set.data: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#>     Checking section 1 of 40 of set.data: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#> Generating bootstrap index matrix: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#> Packaging and returning result: Mon Jul 24 14:26:01 2023
#Without adjustment
prep_beam_specs(beam.data=test.beam.data, endpts=c("MRD29", "OS", "EFS"), firth=TRUE)
#> MRD29 is continuous, fitting lm
#> OS is survival endpoint, fitting coxphf2
#> EFS is survival endpoint, fitting coxphf2
#>           name    mtx                                         mdl
#> 1 Lesion.MRD29 Lesion    lm(MRD29~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 2    RNA.MRD29    RNA    lm(MRD29~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 3    Lesion.OS Lesion  coxphf2(OS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 4       RNA.OS    RNA  coxphf2(OS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 5   Lesion.EFS Lesion coxphf2(EFS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 6      RNA.EFS    RNA coxphf2(EFS~mtx.row,data=main.data,model=T)
# With adjustment
prep_beam_specs(beam.data=test.beam.data, endpts=c("OS", "EFS"), adjvars=c("MRD29"), firth=TRUE)
#> OS is survival endpoint, fitting coxphf2
#> EFS is survival endpoint, fitting coxphf2
#>         name    mtx                                               mdl
#> 1  Lesion.OS Lesion  coxphf2(OS~mtx.row+MRD29,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 2     RNA.OS    RNA  coxphf2(OS~mtx.row+MRD29,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 3 Lesion.EFS Lesion coxphf2(EFS~mtx.row+MRD29,data=main.data,model=T)
#> 4    RNA.EFS    RNA coxphf2(EFS~mtx.row+MRD29,data=main.data,model=T)
